title: Watershed Profiles
text:
This page contains detailed profiles of watersheds important for Pacific salmon conservation.


Watershed profiles provide comprehensive information about the physical, biological, and management characteristics of salmon-bearing watersheds.




Major river systems
Coastal watersheds
Urban watersheds
Transboundary watersheds




Each watershed profile includes: - Physical characteristics - Habitat conditions - Species presence and abundance - Conservation status - Restoration activities - Management considerations



Links to interactive watershed mapping tools and resources.



Access to detailed watershed assessments and supporting data.

title: Regional Management and Assessment Frameworks
text:

title: Management Domains
text:
This page describes the management domains used in Pacific salmon conservation planning.


Management domains provide a framework for organizing conservation and management activities across different geographic and jurisdictional areas.




Regional domains
Sub-regional domains
Local management areas
Cross-boundary considerations




Each management domain is defined by: - Geographic boundaries - Ecological characteristics - Jurisdictional authorities - Management objectives - Conservation priorities




Inter-agency coordination
Indigenous government partnerships
Stakeholder engagement
Transboundary cooperation




How management domains are applied in practice: - Planning processes - Resource allocation - Monitoring and assessment - Adaptive management



Management domain maps, descriptions, and coordination frameworks.

title: Fishery Management Unit Profiles
text:
This page provides profiles of fishery management units relevant to Pacific salmon conservation.


Fishery management units define the spatial and temporal boundaries for fishery management decisions.




Commercial fisheries
Recreational fisheries
First Nations fisheries
Terminal fisheries
Mixed-stock fisheries




Each profile includes: - Geographic boundaries - Target species - Fishing methods - Management measures - Conservation concerns



Detailed profiles and management documents are available here.

title: Marine Planning Profile
text:
This page provides information about marine planning initiatives relevant to Pacific salmon conservation.


Marine planning integrates conservation and management considerations across marine ecosystems where Pacific salmon spend portions of their life cycle.




Coastal marine areas
Estuarine environments
Near-shore habitats
Open ocean zones





Habitat mapping
Species distribution
Human use patterns
Conservation priorities
Climate change considerations




How marine planning supports Pacific salmon conservation objectives: - Critical habitat protection - Migration corridor conservation - Feeding area management - Climate adaptation planning



Marine planning documents, maps, and tools.

title: Stock Management Unit Profiles
text:
This page contains profiles of stock management units for Pacific salmon conservation.


Stock management units are fundamental components of salmon conservation planning and management.




Chinook salmon units
Coho salmon units
Chum salmon units
Pink salmon units
Sockeye salmon units
Steelhead units




Key factors in stock management unit planning and implementation.



Links to detailed profiles and supporting documentation.
